title.narrative: Save the Children, Child Protection II 2017-2019

description.narrative:
Rädda Barnen Sverige har ansökt om finansiering hos Sida om ett totalt belopp om 26 409 796 SEK för att utföra ett regional program för integrering av skydd av barn inom den afrikanska freds- och säkerhetsarkitekturen under perioden 2017-2019. Programmet syftar till att stärka den afrikanska fredsbevarande arkitekturens kapacitet att förebygga och hantera våld mot barn genom att a) träna afrikanska fredsbevarande trupper och nationella militära kontingenter från truppbidragande länder i barnrättsperspektiv och skydd av barn, b) stödja institutionaliseringen av en standardiserad läroplan och verktyg för skydd av barn, c) stödja utvecklingen av mekanismer för ansvarsutkrävande för skydd av barn i afrikanska fredsbevarande strukturer, d) generera kunskap och bevis gällande situationen för barn i väpnad konflikt, samt e) facilitera deltagande av barn i regionala policyskapande och beslutsfattande processer.
Rädda Barnen Sverige kommer att genomföra programmet genom Internationella Rädda Barnens programenhet i Nairobi. Programenheten är ett av Internationella Rädda Barnens regionala kontor och är ansvarig för genomförandet av regionala program i Afrika. Andra landkontor, bla i Senegal, kommer att involveras i programmets implementering. Del av det svenska stödet kommer transfereras till den regionala programenheten från Rädda Barnen Sverige, och sedan göras tillgänglig för de olika kontoren på kontinenten i enlighet med ansvarsfördelningen av programmets olika delar. Den regionala programenheten har ansvar för koordineringen.
Programmets totala budget är 26 409 796 SEK, och kommer att finansieras helt av Sida. Motsvarande ungefär 2 miljoner SEK av budgeten kommer att vidareförmedlas från den regionala programenheten i Nairobi till regionala genomförandepartners i Afrika, inklusive AU-afilierade träningscenter, den östafrikanska beredskapsstyrkan, samt ECOWAS beredskapsstyrka.

The project goal is to ensure the rights of children affected by violence or in armed conflict are protected by defence and security forces that are effectively capacitated to play their mandated role as defenders of Child Rights. This will be achieved through working with and strengthening the structures of the African Standby Forces and key Peacekeeping contributing countries of sub-Saharan Africa

The overall objective is to enhance capacity of African Peace Support Architecture to prevent and respond to violence against children and more specifically, Child rights governance and Child Protection. In light of these overall objective the project is set to work towards achieving the following fours specific targets: 1. Enhancing the capacity and commitment of the AU Peace and Security Department (AU PSD), the East Africa Standby Force, the ECOWAS Standby Force, and selected Member States to prevent and respond to violence against children 2. Advocating for and supporting the above entities to have a functional accountability framework on child protection 3. Contributing towards increased knowledge, evidence and collective understanding on child rights and child protection issues within Peace Support Operations 4. Facilitating increased participation of children affected by armed conflict in decisions and processes of the AU, Regional Mechanisms/Bodies and Member States

description.narrative: Save the Children International is the world's largest independent child rights organization, underpinned by a vision of a world in which every child attains the right to survival, protection, development and participation. Its mission is to inspire breakthroughs in the way the world treats children, and to achieve immediate and lasting change in their lives. Save the Children (SC) works with governments, community partners, non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and other stakeholders. Overall, the Save the Children’s work within the Integrating Child Protection within the African Peace and Security Architecture (ICPAPSA) Project has contributed positively to human security as well as the protection and inclusion of child rights. Some examples of impact of this project can be identified and summarized as follows: - Training 15,299 peacekeepers on child protection. - Adoption of the new child protection training curriculum by the Eastern Africa Standby Force (EASF) and 10 member states. - Trained 224 master trainers and Training of Trainers (ToT) training for 24 facilitators. - Developed an accountability framework for implementation for Uganda and Senegal as personnel contributing countries to peace keeping missions in Africa. - The AU established an Inter-Agency Support Group on Integrating Child Protection into the AU Peace and Security Department (AU PSD) Agenda with SC represented in the working group as co-convener, which allows SC direct influence on the CAAC accountability agenda in Africa. - Held capacity-building training for national-level child-focused CSOs in Mali and South Sudan, where CSOs are trained on principles, methodologies and tools of child participation. - Developed the Child Participation Guidelines, which inspired the African Committee of Experts on the Rights and Welfare of the Child (ACERWC) to do the same.
